div.p: TOPdesk helps orgnizations to improve their service management.

dl.dd: Make things as easy as possible for your customer. Give them software that is simple to use and implement, be transparent about your products and services, and offer a good self-service portal that boosts customer independence.

No department is an island. Your customers rely on IT, facilities and other services – with each handling requests in their own way. Save your customers a lot of hassle by offering a single point of contact, and even by sharing your processes. With all departments on the same page, communication with your customers becomes more straightforward, and makes your services easier to manage. That's what ESM (sometimes called Shared Service Management or SSM) is about.

Your department probably works with suppliers. But if they let you down, you may let your customers down. That’s why it’s important to collaborate effectively with your suppliers. How? Start by integrating your tools. This helps both parties manage agreements and stay up-to-date. If you improve the relationship with your supplier, everyone will benefit.

The plugin interacts with TOPdesk REST API. For more details about the API, please consult TOPdesk Appliation Programming Interface.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions in this document, required parameters are shown in bold italics.
IMPORTANT: In the CloudBees Flow UI, go to the Home page, open the Main Menu, and click Admin > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
Setting Up the Plugin Configuration
Plugin configurations are sets of parameters that apply across some or all of the plugin procedures. They reduce repetition of common values, create predefined sets of parameters for end users, and store credentials securely. Each configuration has a unique name that is automatically entered in designated parameters in the procedures.
Input
In the Main Menu, click Admin > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
Find the EC-TOPdesk row.
Click Configure to open the TOPdesk Configurations page.
Click Create Configuration.
To create a TOPdesk configuration, enter the following information and click OK.
Remember that you may need to create additional configurations later.
ParameterDescription
Configuration Name Name of the plugin configuration. (Required)
Description Description of the configuration
Endpoint Endpoit URL to target, such as "https://demo.topdesk.net". (Required)
Credential
User Name: Enter the user name. This parameter is case sensitive. (Required)
Password: Enter the password. This parameter is case sensitive. (Required)
Retype Password: Re-enter the password. This parameter is case sensitive. (Required)
